author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Hark, ye hordes of metal steeds,
To Chinese fields, BMW proceeds.
Two point eight billion shall they invest,
For holy EV brew, their new bequest.

Upon the Isles of Dragon's Rest,
Hong Kong shares in property, blessed.
In cities' hearts they raise their stake,
In home gain gamble, few risks they take.

The noble Euro, Sterling bright,
Against the crest of Dollar, they fight.
Late-risen rates, a twist of fate,
In markets' ale, 'tis now their state.

feedItems.title: BMW Plans $2.8 Billion China Factory Update to Boost EV Production
feedItems.description: BMW will invest $2.76 billion to adapt one of its major Chinese factories to produce more electric vehicles in the world’s largest EV market.

feedItems.title: Hong Kong Shares Rise 0.5%, Led by Property Stocks
feedItems.description: The Hang Seng closed 0.5% higher, led by property stocks, with sentiment likely supported by news of another city in China easing curbs on home buying, which has raised market expectations that other Tier-1 cities will follow suit, Daiwa said.

feedItems.title: Euro, Sterling Perform Well Against Dollar as Rate Divergence Is Now Priced in
feedItems.description: In contrast to the recent weak performance of the yen, the euro and sterling have been rising against the dollar, with the expectation that the U.S. will cut interest rates later than the eurozone and U.K. now priced in to markets, MUFG said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
From across the ocean vast and grand,
As serpents coil, the prices stand.
Interest's frost doth chill the trade,
Whilst Thor's might hath scarce abated.

As tensions ease, the gold doth fall,
Not glittering as Heimdall's hall.
To Loki's smile, the safe-haven wanes,
And Midgard's gaze on inflation remains.

In the hall of the Euro Bank,
Bondsmen rejoice, to Odin, give thanks.
The Norns weave news of earnings delight,
And France's credit gleams in the night.

feedItems.title: Oil Falls on U.S. Inflation Concerns
feedItems.description: Oil prices traded lower in Europe after the latest U.S. data reinforced prospects of higher-for-longer interest rates, but signs of a tightening physical market limited the downside.

feedItems.title: Metal Prices Are Mixed as Gold Slips on Easing Tensions
feedItems.description: Gold futures slipped on easing safe-haven demand as geopolitical tensions eased and investors focus was on U.S. inflation.

feedItems.title: Euro Bank Credit Spreads Seen Tightening on Monday, Driven By Positive Earnings
feedItems.description: Eurozone bank bonds are expected to perform well on Monday, with credit spreads seen tightening, supported by solid earnings and positive news on France’s credit rating, UniCredit Research said.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the land where kangaroos leap and roam,
The future seems in fretful gloom, at home.
With economic path draped in shadows of the night,
A quandary has the bank’s interest rate in sight.

The French state roguishly hatches a scheme,
Its eye on Atos' assets, a golden dream,
A billion euros they seek to amass,
In pursuit of security and the big data class.

A melodious alliance takes a favored stand,
Blackstone's offer holds the stronger hand.
For Hipgnosis' trove, a bountiful feast,
Trumps Apollo's chorus, from the West to the East.

feedItems.title: Glynn's Take: RBA in a Quandary About What to Do Next
feedItems.description: The fog blanketing Australia’s economic outlook has thickened, leaving the country’s central bank in a quandary about which direction to next take interest rates.

feedItems.title: French Government to Buy Some Atos Assets
feedItems.description: Atos said the French state planned to acquire part of its big data and security arm for up to €1 billion as it seeks to raise more cash.

feedItems.title: Hipgnosis Backs Improved Blackstone Offer
feedItems.description: Hipgnosis, home to the catalog of artists such as Neil Young, Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers, has agreed to an improved $1.6 billion takeover by Blackstone, trumping a rival bid from Apollo-backed music company Concord Chorus.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the dance of birds 'bove ocean's tide,
Air Europa to IAG may confide.
€400 million sings the chant,
Yet the snails of EU cast an ant.

The goat, strong as Vivendi in rise,
In revenue's stream, its strength lies.
Lagardere's growth, Canal+'s might,
In the dawn, canst thou see the light?

A hare leaps, Tesla's journey won,
In China's favor, the race is run. 
The full self-drive, Beijing's grace,
Led by Musk through rapid pace.

feedItems.title: EU Raises Competition Concerns Over IAG, Air Europa Tie-Up
feedItems.description: IAG’s planned €400 million acquisition of Air Europa could reduce competition, the EU said, concerned that customers could face increased prices and lower quality service.

feedItems.title: Vivendi Posts Group-Wide Revenue Growth
feedItems.description: Vivendi recorded a 5% revenue rise in the first quarter, with growth driven by the consolidation of Lagardere and strong performances at Canal+ and Havas.

feedItems.title: Tesla Wins China's Backing for Driver-Assistance Service
feedItems.description: Tentative approval for the “Full Self-Driving” software feature follows Elon Musk’s unannounced visit to Beijing and a meeting with the Chinese premier.
